translations.text: Nay,<sup foot_note="182437">1</sup> I swear by the Day of Resurrection;
and nay, I swear by the self-reproaching soul!<sup foot_note="182438">1</sup>
Does man imagine that We will not be able to bring his bones together again?<sup foot_note="182439">1</sup>
Yes indeed; We have the power to remould even his finger-tips.<sup foot_note="182440">1</sup>
But man desires to persist in his evil ways.<sup foot_note="182441">1</sup>
He asks: “When will the Day of Resurrection be?”<sup foot_note="182442">1</sup>
When the sight is dazed,<sup foot_note="182443">1</sup>
and the moon is eclipsed,
and the sun and the moon are joined together,<sup foot_note="182383">1</sup>
on that Day will man say: “Whither the refuge?”
No, there is no refuge.
With your Lord alone will be the retreat that Day.
On that Day will man be apprised of his deeds, both the earlier and the later.<sup foot_note="182409">1</sup>
But lo, man is well aware of himself,
even though he might make up excuses.<sup foot_note="182444">1</sup>
(O Prophet),<sup foot_note="182445">1</sup> do not stir your tongue hastily (to commit the Revelation to memory).
Surely it is for Us to have you commit it to memory and to recite it.
And so when We recite it,<sup foot_note="182446">1</sup> follow its recitation attentively;
then it will be for Us to explain it.<sup foot_note="182447">1</sup>
Nay;<sup foot_note="182448">1</sup> the truth is that you love ardently (the good of this world) that can be obtained hastily,
and are oblivious of the Hereafter.<sup foot_note="182449">1</sup>
Some faces on that Day will be fresh and resplendent,<sup foot_note="182450">1</sup>
and will be looking towards their Lord;<sup foot_note="182451">1</sup>
and some faces on that Day will be gloomy,
believing that a crushing calamity is about to strike them.
Nay;<sup foot_note="182452">1</sup> when a man's soul reaches up to the throat,
and it is said: “Is there any enchanter who can step forward and help (by his chanting)?”<sup foot_note="182453">1</sup>
and he realises that the hour of parting is come,
and calf is inter-twined with calf.<sup foot_note="182454">1</sup>
On that Day you will be driven to your Lord.
But he did not verify the Truth, nor did he observe Prayer;
on the contrary, he gave the lie to the Truth and turned his back upon it,
then he went back to his kinsfolk, elated with pride.<sup foot_note="182455">1</sup>
This (attitude) is worthy of you, altogether worthy;
again, it is worthy of you, altogether worthy.<sup foot_note="182456">1</sup>
Does man<sup foot_note="182457">1</sup> think that he will be left alone, unquestioned?<sup foot_note="182458">2</sup>
Was he not a drop of ejaculated semen,
then he became a clot, and then Allah made it into a living body and proportioned its parts,
and then He made of him a pair, male and female?
Does He, then, not have the power to bring back the dead to life?<sup foot_note="182459">1</sup>
